definition: to be one's old self (idiom)/to be unchanged/(derog.) to be stuck in one's ways
to depend on/to comply with or listen to sb/according to/in the light of
correct/right/so/thus/like this/-ly
happening/instance/reason/cause/intentional/former/old/friend/therefore/hence/(of people) to die, dead
I/me/my

sentences.english: I am still my old self.
I read the entire New Testament, but I was my old self, and hadn't changed.
sentences.chinese: 我讀完整卷新約，卻依然故我，絲毫未變。

sentences.english: The next morning he was unchanged, carrying a gun to hunt the mountains.
sentences.chinese: 隔天早上他依然故我，背著一隻槍上山去打獵了。

definition: back to where we were (idiom); absolutely no improvement/Things haven't changed at all.
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
to turn a blind eye to
to block one's ears and not listen (idiom); to turn a deaf ear
to hear but not react (idiom); to turn a deaf ear/to ignore deliberately
to remain unmoved
as before/as in the past
completely
to take a laissez-faire attitude
to set to one side and ignore (idiom); quite indifferent/cold and uncaring
cool and collected (idiom); showing no sign of nerves/perfectly composed
see 泰然處之|泰然处之[tai4 ran2 chu3 zhi1]
happy and content (idiom)
bear hardship with equanimity/regard wrongdoing with equanimity
as usual
to talk and laugh as though nothing had happened/to remain cheerful (despite a crisis)
